text: Create a zip file from a generator in Python?
I've got a large amount of data (a couple gigs) I need to write to a zip file in Python.
I can't load it all into memory at once to pass to the .writestr method of ZipFile, and I really don't want to feed it all out to disk using temporary files and then read it back.
Is there a way to feed a generator or a file-like object to the ZipFile library?
Or is there some reason this capability doesn't seem to be supported?
By zip file, I mean zip file.
As supported in the Python zipfile package.
